'Conjugate variables' are pairs of variables mathematically defined in such a
way that they become Fourier transform duals of one
another, [http://www.aip.org/history/heisenberg/p08a.htm Heisenberg â
Quantum Mechanics, 1925â1927: The Uncertainty
Relations] [http://www.springerlink.com/content/r40472577250313r/
Some remarks on time and energy as conjugate variables] or more
generally are related through Pontryagin duality. The duality relations lead
naturally to an uncertainty in physics called the Heisenberg uncertainty
principle relation between them. In mathematical terms, conjugate variables
are part of a symplectic basis, and the uncertainty principle corresponds to
the symplectic form.
